info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 3:14PM EDT until July 23 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Eastern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... Marion County in northern West Virginia... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 314 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Waynesburg to 8 miles north of Salem, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Fairmont, Westover, Mannington, Star City, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Monongah, Granville, Fairview, and Hundred. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
